content.description: Start with a hanging start and a heel hook on the small ledge to your right. Bump your right hand up and move your feet under you (but don't use the ground!). Smack both hands on top of the boulder. The left side has very few footholds, so get a high heel hook in, then do a splits to a right side foothold (hence the name stretch). Press yourself up from here.
content.location: Left side of big wall, the larger of the two boulders there (and the only one with an "underhang").

content.description: Start on the left side of a head-level wall with your hands on top of the strip. Get your feet on the rock and shuffle your way out to the right. There will be a combination of slopers and crimps that you can use to get to the perch, so stay low. Once close to the perch, make a big move with your right hand out to it, and walk up and around and enjoy your send of this easy, fun route.
content.location: Somewhere around the middle of big wall under a tree which hangs slightly over the rock face. The start is left of the perch and under the tree.
